title: 190 nations and organisations pledge to quit coal
content: Big coal users like Poland and Canada vow to phase it out, but key players China and India have not.

title: Iran nuclear talks to resume within weeks
content: Vienna will play host, more than three years after the US abandoned a landmark agreement.

title: Oil giant says it needs oil to fund green shift
content: Shell says it needs the cash from fossil fuel production to fund its transition to green energy.

title: 'I hope people would be more sceptical today' - Knox
content: Amanda Knox talks about losing control of her identity during the Meredith Kercher murder investigation.

title: 'Tour de force' novel wins Booker Prize
content: South African author Damon Galgut wins the prestigious literary award at the third attempt.

title: Biden rejects blame for shock Virginia vote loss
content: The president cites schools, jobs, petrol prices and "Trump voters" as reasons for the defeat.

title: Tennis star accuses top Chinese official of abuse
content: It is the first time sexual assault allegations have been made against a senior Chinese leader.

title: Deadly US drone strike did not break law - Pentagon
content: The attack that killed three adults and seven children was an "honest mistake", the Pentagon says.

title: CO2 emissions show rapid rebound after Covid dip
content: Global carbon emissions are set to get back close to the levels they were at before Covid.

title: Israeli spyware group added to US trade blacklist
content: NSO Group, which makes the Pegasus spyware, acted against US interests, officials say.

title: Halloween's over, so what do you do with costumes?
content: We asked experts: how bad is Halloween textile waste and how can you avoid adding to it?

title: Hijab campaign tweets pulled after French backlash
content: The Council of Europe released the posts for a campaign against anti-Muslim discrimination.

title: Facebook says Ethiopian PM's post incited violence
content: The social giant deletes Abiy Ahmed's post which urged citizens to "bury" a rebel group.

title: Libya could work with US on Lockerbie extradition
content: Its foreign minister is "positive" in the case of a man wanted by the US over the 1988 plane bombing.

title: COP26: So far, so good-ish
content: The latest global news, sport, weather and documentaries
